Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This fragment of papyrus (P.Fay. 217), which comes from Euhemeria (Qasr el-Banat) and which dates from the 2nd or 3rd century of our time, contains, on the recto, an extract frm the "Acts of the Alexandrian Martyrs". These writings, which were developed under the Empire, praise the resistance of alexandrian patriots to the encroachment of imperial power. They owe their name to the similarity of tone and spirit with the "Acts of Christian Martyrs". The verso carries a fragment of accounts.
